Why don't changes like this receive feedback BEFORE not AFTER implementation?

Nothing that's not on PBE ever gets released on Live servers.
So this change must've been on PBE before it got shipped and there clearly wasn't such feedback present there. Unless you want to point to that clairvoyant person in the crowd that can help Riot make changes before people point them out, this is how it's going to stay.
It was on PBE can confirm. It was probably too late to pull the changes though (since patches are essentially "locked" two weeks in advance).

Sure, PBE changes are locked in advance for Live shipping but they were there.
The point being is that not many people are there or they particularly care to give such feedback. They're probably there trying out new VGUs, champs or buying chests to try their luck.

In this case, more valuable feedback happens from Live servers, when people take notice on a massive scale and they voice their concerns. Saying things like "the person who did this should be fired", isn't helping make the argument in itself any stronger. It's actually the opposite.

Will you revert the "Vision Score" changes? Knowing that someone has a 22 vision score is *INFINITELY LESS IMPORTANT* than knowing how many wards your team mates have available to use. I feel like you lose a lot of coordination strategy by not seeing your allies wards so you can plan how to set up vision. Supports need to know if they can coordinate river bush and lane bushes, and they also need to know if they should ward the dragon if the jungler can't. Same goes for top lane - they should know if they need to ward the Rift Herald if the jungler can't. Vision score should have been tacked onto the KDA GUI, and not used to replace important game information.
Not being able to see wards left was not a change, it is a bug.  They don't know whats causing it.

Is it really a bug? The vision score number takes up a lot of space on that ward icon, so adding an additional number to show us available wards seems like it would be clutter, not to mention slightly confusing.

The vision score change was made after the bugs discovery, basically they dont know how to _fix_ the ward count sonthe vision score was made more visible to make up for it.  Since vision scores were always visible if you hovered the trinket.
All they need to do is take vision score off the scoreboard entirely. It's not critical game info your team needs to see. It can exist just fine a part of the KDA GUI.
Except if you can see it in game you can see it increase.  Since it was visible my wards scores have drastically increased.

I'm assuming I was downvoted because people don't know what KDA GUI is. Kills, Death, Assists Graphical User Interface, or, the interface at the top corner of the screen that presents you with your KDA information, your ping, your FPS, and all that. Vision score can be a part of this interface, as vision score isn't relevant information that your team needs to know.
Shifting the vision score to be part of your own GUI  instead of the scoreboard, so that we can see how many trinkets our allies have again, would be an adjustment that would allow you to still have the information for your purposes, but wouldn't remove important team information from the scoreboard.
The wards being missing is a glitch, i told you that.  And its been on scire board for months.  Why should it suddenly be removed?

It hasn't been on the score board for months, and if it was, it was so totally insignificant that it didn't make a difference. I've been regularly using the scoreboard to monitor the wards people have for months now, and it was just over the last patch that the wards got replaced by vision score. If this a bug, it needs to be fixed. If this was some experiment, they need to cut that shit out  and remove it.
